page.title: 14VILLAGE POLICEMAN,FENSTANTON
page.content: {Seven hundred years ago,}in the reign of Edward 1 they introduced the office of{Fenstanton Parish Constable. The job was underpaid and unpopular.If elected there would be penalties for refusing to serve,so the appointment was passed on from year to year. {The Lord of the Manor}managed the village through his steward and minor offences could be handled. {By the 17th century}the management of the village was passing from the Manor court to the Vestry.{In 1728}the Vestry elected 2 constables,{John {Townesend }and {John Goodgame}but it was not a profitable job. {Now our Village Policeman is {PC BUCKINGHAM.}He lives at the Police House,Conington Road, Fenstanton.He has an answer phone but can also be contacted at{HINCHINGBROKE.}
